messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{
  "files": [
    {
      "id": "file_mob_planning_deep_dive_notes_20251111",
      "name": "MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies) ‚Äì Meeting Notes",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-11T17:05:00-05:00",
      "content": "MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)
Date: Tue, Nov 11, 2025
Time: 3:45‚Äì4:30pm ET
Location: Zoom
Participants: Alex (PM), Jordan (Eng), Sam (R&D), Taylor (Eng Lead)
Related Jira: MOB-100, MOB-101

Goals
- Align on scope for initial Mobile App Launch slice
- Identify key risks and technical constraints
- Confirm dependencies and owners ahead of the 11/10 Planning milestone

Agenda
1) Quick recap of current MOB status
2) Scope discussion for initial launch
3) Risks and technical constraints
4) Dependencies and owners
5) Next steps and follow-ups

Key Discussion Points
- Scope
  - Focus on beta cohort expansion and stabilizing core feature set from MOB-101.
  - Defer non-critical nice-to-haves to post-launch milestone where possible.

- Risks
  - Performance: While we‚Äôve seen ~15% improvement in p95 latency (420ms ‚Üí 357ms), Jordan highlighted that we are still slightly above the stretch target for lower-end devices.
  - Reliability: Need more soak time on the new batching optimization before we scale traffic.
  - Organizational: R&D bandwidth is tight around interview blocks; Sam flagged this as a scheduling constraint.

- Dependencies
  - Analytics team to expose additional funnels for beta cohort monitoring.
  - Design to finalize empty-state flows for the new core feature.
  - Infra to confirm capacity assumptions for projected 10‚Äì15% DAU growth.

Decisions
- Proceed with current initial launch slice as tracked in MOB-100 and MOB-101, with explicit call-outs on what‚Äôs moving to post-launch.
- Use next two sprints to focus on perf and reliability hardening.

Action Items
- Alex: Update MOB roadmap and Planning milestone doc to reflect decisions and risks.
- Jordan: Coordinate with Eng team on perf test plan and tracking.
- Sam: Validate batching optimization under peak load scenarios and share summary.
- Taylor: Review and sign off on updated launch slice proposal prior to Planning milestone freeze.
"
    },
    {
      "id": "file_mob_planning_milestone_brief_20251110",
      "name": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Planning Milestone Brief",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-10T18:12:00-05:00",
      "content": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Planning Milestone Brief
Milestone: Planning
Date: Nov 10, 2025
Primary Jira: MOB-100 (Initial Setup), MOB-101 (Core Feature)

1. Overview
The Mobile App Launch (MOB) initiative is approaching the Planning milestone on Nov 10, 2025. This brief summarizes the proposed initial launch slice, key risks, dependencies, and success metrics to validate during and after launch.

2. Current Status
- MOB-100: Initial Setup ‚Äì Status: Done
  - Core infrastructure for the mobile client and CI/CD pipeline provisioned.
  - Basic authentication and analytics instrumentation in place.

- MOB-101: Core Feature ‚Äì Status: In Progress
  - Core feature implementation at ~70% completion.
  - Performance passes underway; preliminary results show material improvement in p95 latency for key flows.

3. Proposed Initial Launch Slice
- Target cohort: Existing web users invited to beta via in-product nudge.
- Core capabilities at launch:
  - Authentication + session management.
  - Primary user journey supported end-to-end.
  - Limited push notifications for key events.
- Deferred to post-launch:
  - Advanced personalization.
  - In-app help/FAQ center.
  - Secondary, low-usage flows.

4. Risks & Mitigations (to be deep-dived in MOB Planning session)
- Performance
  - We‚Äôve observed an approximate 15% decrease in p95 latency vs. last week‚Äôs baseline (420ms ‚Üí 357ms).
  - Risk: Still need more data on lower-end devices; perf regressions may appear under higher load.
  - Mitigation: Dedicated perf sprints and load testing, plus close monitoring post-launch.

- Adoption & Engagement
  - Early signals show ~10% week-over-week growth in daily active users (DAU) in the beta cohort.
  - Risk: Growth is mostly organic; without structured campaigns, ramp may be slower than target.
  - Mitigation: Coordinate small, targeted placements once stability is proven.

5. Dependencies
- Analytics: Additional funnels for beta usage and retention.
- Design: Final UX for edge cases and empty states.
- Infrastructure: Capacity validation for projected DAU growth.

6. Next Steps
- Use the MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive session (scheduled for Tue, Nov 11, 3:45‚Äì4:30pm ET) to:
  - Validate and, if needed, adjust the initial launch slice.
  - Confirm risk owners and mitigations.
  - Align on a realistic timeline toward the Development and Launch milestones.
- Post-session, Alex will update this brief and the MOB roadmap to reflect final decisions.
"
    },
    {
      "id": "file_mob_metrics_export_20251031_20251106",
      "name": "MOB Metrics Export ‚Äì 2025-10-31 to 2025-11-06",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-07T15:05:00-05:00",
      "content": "Metric,Previous Value,Current Value,Delta,Notes
p95_latency_ms,420,357,-15%,Latest Mobile build; batching optimization rolled out mid-week
daily_active_users,2000,2200,+10%,Beta cohort only; mostly organic growth
weekly_active_users,3100,3410,+10%,Trend consistent with DAU uplift

Summary
- Performance: Approximately 15% improvement in p95 latency for key mobile flows (420ms ‚Üí 357ms).
- User Growth: Daily active users in the beta cohort increased by roughly 10% week-over-week (2000 ‚Üí 2200).
- Interpretation: Early signs of positive traction, with performance trending toward launch targets.

This export was generated from the internal analytics system for the Mobile App Launch (MOB) project to support the weekly update and Planning milestone prep.
"
    },
    {
      "id": "file_mob_weekly_update_nov_3_7_draft",
      "name": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7) ‚Äì Draft",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-07T16:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "Draft: Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)
Owner: Alex (PM)
Primary audience: Taylor (Eng Lead) for review

1) Performance improvements
- We saw roughly a 15% improvement in p95 latency on the latest Mobile build (420ms ‚Üí 357ms), driven primarily by the batching optimization Sam‚Äôs team rolled out mid-week.
- Data source: Internal analytics export for 2025-10-31 to 2025-11-06.

2) Early user traction
- Daily active users for the beta cohort increased ~10% week-over-week.
- Most of this appears organic, with a modest lift from the new in-product nudge.

3) Planning alignment
- We scheduled a dedicated planning deep dive for next week to finalize scope, risks, and dependencies ahead of the 11/10 Planning milestone.
- Session details
  - Title: "MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive (scope, risks, dependencies)"
  - When: Tue, Nov 11, 2025, 3:45‚Äì4:30pm ET
  - Where: Zoom (link in calendar invite)
  - Who: Alex (PM), Jordan (Eng), Sam (R&D), Taylor (Eng Lead)

Notes for Taylor
- Please confirm that the 15% perf improvement framing and the 10% DAU growth characterization ("mostly organic") align with your understanding.
- Suggestion from Taylor: Soften the wording around planning to emphasize that we are still pre-Planning milestone and aligning rather than locking scope.
"
    },
    {
      "id": "file_mob_weekly_update_nov_3_7_final",
      "name": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-07T16:35:00-05:00",
      "content": "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Weekly Update (Nov 3‚Äì7)
Owner: Alex (PM)
Distribution: VP Product, Mobile Leads, key stakeholders

1) Performance
We saw an approximately 15% improvement in p95 latency on the latest Mobile build (from ~420ms down to ~357ms). This came from a batching optimization that Sam‚Äôs team rolled out mid-week and brings us closer to our launch target, especially for the beta cohort.

2) Early user traction
Daily active users in the beta cohort grew about 10% week-over-week (from ~2000 to ~2200). Most of this appears to be organic growth, with a modest contribution from a new in-product nudge we enabled.

3) Planning
We have a focused planning session scheduled for next week to align on scope, risks, and dependencies ahead of the upcoming Planning milestone for MOB. Coming out of that, we‚Äôll finalize the initial launch slice and update the roadmap accordingly.

Supporting docs
- Metrics source: "MOB Metrics Export ‚Äì 2025-10-31 to 2025-11-06" (internal analytics export).
- Planning context: "Mobile App Launch ‚Äì Planning Milestone Brief" and the upcoming "MOB ‚Äì Planning Deep Dive" meeting notes.
"
    }
  ]
}
